No, pilots are not able to turn off the cockpit voice recorder (CVR) during a flight. The CVR is activated automatically when the aircraft's engines start and it runs continuously until the engines are shut down after the flight. 

Furthermore, tampering with or disabling the CVR is illegal under aviation regulations, and pilots can face severe penalties for doing so. The CVR is an essential tool in aviation safety, and disabling it would hinder accident investigations and compromise the safety of flights.

In addition, although the recordings of the CVR are primarily used for accident investigations, they may also be used for routine safety inspections, training and education, and other purposes that potentially improve aviation safety.
